name: From Mozart to Mamma Mia
description:
Step into a world where classical elegance meets pop brilliance! 

Join us for an extraordinary concert that combines the timeless symphonies of Mozart with the unforgettable hits of ABBA. Feel the magic as Mozart's masterful compositions soar alongside the infectious energy of ABBA's legendary anthems. 

From the grandeur of the classical era to the irresistible charm of disco, this performance blends two iconic musical worlds in a celebration of harmony, rhythm, and unforgettable melodies. It's a night you won't want to miss, a perfect fusion of sophistication and pure pop joy! Featuring guest artists Luri Lee and students from the Glenn Gould School.

name: World Wildlife Day Nature Walk in High Park
description:
Celebrate World Wildlife Day with a guided walk, focused on this year's theme of medicinal and aromatic plants. 

Discover how local species have been used for healing, food, and ceremony, and learn how they support ecological health in Toronto. 

Along the way, we'll bridge traditional knowledge with modern science, explore global threats to medicinal plants, and discuss why their conservation matters. Come prepared to walk, observe nature up close, and join meaningful conversations about the vital role plants play in human well-being and biodiversity.

Suitable for participants ages 16 and up.

name: Chanticleer

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
The celebrated Grammy Award-winning vocal ensemble returns with a program of a cappella choral music, ranging from Renaissance masterworks to roof-raising spirituals.

Chanticleer has been hailed as "the world's reigning male chorus" by The New Yorker and is known around the world as "an orchestra of voices" for its wide-ranging repertoire and dazzling virtuosity. 

Founded in San Francisco in 1978 by singer and musicologist Louis Botto, Chanticleer quickly took its place as one of the most prolific recording and touring ensembles in the world, selling over one million recordings and performing thousands of live concerts to audiences around the world.

Please join us! This concert is preceded by a short performance by talented students of The Royal Conservatory.
